UI

Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • UI.GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Runnable
    This class has two main functions : Take in key inputs and displays the game on the screen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • render

        private void render()
        Render() takes care of the graphical processing of the game. We use a bufferStrategy to pre-render frames for smoother game. It calls on renderScreen() to update each pixels in the game,then use g.draw to draw it in the canvas

      • renderScreen

        public void renderScreen(int[] pixels)
        renderScreen() draws the game by updating each pixels in the game window

        pixels -
